intro: Ammannia gazensis, commonly known as the African ammannia, is a herbaceous plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It belongs to the family Lygulocarpaceae and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that are typically arranged in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in swampy areas or along riverbanks. Ammannia gazensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
